stork.feather

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.Path
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    URI

    public abstract class Path
extends java.lang.Object
    A representation of an absolute Path adhering to RFC 3986's definition of URI path components extended to support glob pattern matching.

    This class is designed to be memory-efficient for storing very large path trees. The instantiation of new Paths is controlled internally, and create(String) must be used to parse strings into Path objects.

    All paths are absolute paths and will never contain components with the names ".." or ".".

    Path objects are immutable and are safe to use as keys in a map or entries in a set.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Path DOT
      A top-level "." segment, used to represent an empty relative Path.
      static Path DOTDOT
      A top-level ".." segment.
      static Path ROOT
      The top-level parent of all absolute Paths.

    • Field Detail

      • ROOT

        public static final Path ROOT
        The top-level parent of all absolute Paths. It cannot be traversed above.

      • DOT

        public static final Path DOT
        A top-level "." segment, used to represent an empty relative Path.

      • DOTDOT

        public static final Path DOTDOT
        A top-level ".." segment.

      • segmentMatches

        public abstract boolean segmentMatches(Path path)
        Check if the last segment of Path matches the last segment of the given Path. This will only check if the end segments match. Use matches(Path) to test for matches over all segments.
        Parameters:
        path - the Path to match last segments against.
        Returns:
        true if this Path's last segment matches the given Path's last segment; false otherwise.

      • up

        public Path up(int n)
        Return the nth parent of this Path. If n == 0, this Path is returned. If n > 0, this is equivalent to calling up() n times.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of segments to remove.
        Returns:
        The parent of this path segment.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0.

        public Path root()
        Return the top-level parent of this Path segment.
        Returns:
        The parent of this path segment.

        Parameters:

      • append

        public final Path append(Path path)
        Return a new Path with the given Path appended. This is equivalent to path.appendTo(this).
        Parameters:
        path - a path to append.
        Returns:
        A Path with the given Path appended.

      • appendLiteral

        public Path appendLiteral(java.lang.String name)
        Append a segment to this Path whose unescaped name is name. No special interpretation of name will be done, with the exception that the Strings "." and ".." will cause this and up(), respectively, to be returned.
        Parameters:
        name - the unescaped name of the segment to append.
        Returns:
        A Path with a segment whose unescaped name is name appended.

        The unescaped name of this path segment.

      • isAbsolute

        public boolean isAbsolute()
        Check if this Path is absolute. An absolute Path is one whose root is the root Path, i.e. Path.ROOT.
        Returns:
        true if this is an absolute Path; false otherwise.

      • isRelative

        public final boolean isRelative()
        Check if this Path is relative.
        Returns:
        true if this is a relative Path; false otherwise.

      • absolutize

        public Path absolutize()
        Return an absolute Path. This is equivalent to appendTo(Path.ROOT).
        Returns:
        This Path absolutized against the root Path.

      • absolutize

        public Path absolutize(Path root)
        Absolutize this Path against root. The returned Path will not traverse beyond root.
        Returns:
        This Path absolutized against root.

      • explode

        public final java.lang.String[] explode()
        Explode this path into its unescaped component names.
        Returns:
        An array of the names of this path's components.

        public static Path implode(java.lang.String... names)
        Implode an array of unescaped component names into a Path.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        names merged into a Path.

      • isGlob

        public boolean isGlob()
        Check whether or not this is a glob Path. That is, whether or not this Path has a glob segment in it somewhere.
        Returns:
        true if this Path has a glob segment in it somewhere; false otherwise.

      • firstGlob

        public Path firstGlob()
        Return the first glob segment of this Path. That is, return the longest prefix of this Path that is not a glob Path. If the Path is already a non-glob Path, this Path is returned.
        Returns:
        The non-glob prefix Path of this Path.

      • covers

        public boolean covers(Path path)
        Check if this Path covers the given Path.
        Returns:
        true if this Path covers path; false otherwise.

      • length

        public int length()
        Return the number of segments in this Path. This will always be a non-negative number.
        Returns:
        The number of segments in the Path.

      • globToRegex

        public static java.lang.String globToRegex(java.lang.String glob)
        Convert an escaped glob String into a regular expression. The String returned by this method can be used to construct a Pattern matching the CharSequences the glob pattern matches. In other words, this transforms a glob expression into a regular expression.
        Parameters:
        glob - an escaped glob expression to create a regular expression from.
        Returns:
        A regular expression String based on glob.

        Parameters:
        path - the Path to match against.
        Returns:
        true if this Path matches the given Path; false otherwise.
